challenge.title: Task 42
challenge.description:
A function is a set of instructions that perform a specific task. Functions can make code more organized, reusable, and easier to read. For example, a function might calculate the sum of two numbers or display a message to the user.

Think of a function as a small machine in a factory; you give it some input, it does something with that input, and then it gives you an output.

question.text: What does function mean in a programming context?

answers.answer: It is the title of a program.
answers.feedback: A function is not the title but a part of the code designed to perform specific operations.

answers.answer: It is a reusable block of code that performs a specific task.
It refers to a special type of variable.
answers.feedback: While functions can interact with variables, they are not variables themselves but sets of instructions.

answers.answer: It is the main software that runs on a computer.
answers.feedback: A function is a component of software, not the entire software system.
